medium: Light gray marble with medium-sized crystals and some dark gray inclusions
dimensions:
12.6 x 10.1 x 2.9 cm (4 15/16 x 4 x 1 1/8 in.)
h. of inscribed band 4.5 cm, w. of border (right) 1.3 cm, letter h. (Iine 1) 1.5-1.6 cm, interlinear space 0.1-0.2 cm
creditline: Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University
inscribed: Below the relief panel is a two-line inscription in letters neatly, yet shallowly, inscribed. There is a pair of incised guide lines 1.6 cm. apart for the first line of text but not for the smaller and less carefully executed second line. [translated as]: Griefless Helene, farewell! [See accession card for reproduction].

texts.textentryhtml: Purchased April 1938 by the Princeton-led team at Antioch-on-the-Orontes, present-day Antakya, Turkey, 1931-1939; with the Museum since 1939

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 2000," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 60 (2001): p. 66-93.

bibliography.boilertext: Lisa R. Brody and Gail L. Hoffman, eds., Roman in the provinces: art on the periphery of empire, (Chestnut Hill, MA: McMullen Museum of Art, Boston College; Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 2014).
